definition: upright and honest/cheerful/to chat idly/to boast/to talk smoothly
upright and honest/cheerful/to chat idly/to boast/to talk smoothly
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: Are you as well - spoken as the off-the-cuff pundit?
sentences.chinese: 你能如同學者般侃侃而談嗎？

sentences.english: He speaks volubly like a flowing river; many people are attracted to stop and listen.
sentences.chinese: 他口若懸河，侃侃而談，吸引了不少人聽。

sentences.english: Sitting in the student guidance office, Sun Ta-wha chatted amiably with her guests for an afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 坐在學生輔導室的孫老師，陪訪客侃侃而談一個下午。

sentences.english: Perhaps you're already speaking up in team meetings and getting your ideas across effectively.
sentences.chinese: 或許你在團隊會議上，可以就自己的論點侃侃而談。

sentences.english: Husband 8 was a psychologist; all he ever did was talk about it.
sentences.chinese: 第八任是一個心理學家，他所能做的事就是侃侃而談。

definition: unceasing torrent (idiom)/talking non-stop/gabbling forty to the dozen
to be well acquainted with/to know well
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
